articles.title: Slot to hold talks with Salah about facing Brighton
articles.summary: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says he will speak with Mohamed Salah on Friday about whether he will be involved against Brighton on Saturday.

articles.title: BBC to show Macclesfield and Spurs FA Cup ties
articles.summary: Non-league Macclesfield's FA Cup third round tie with holders Crystal Palace will be televised live on BBC One on Saturday, 10 January (12:15 GMT kick-off).

articles.title: 'There can only be one singer' - my secrets of successful man-management
articles.summary: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis looks at man-management and how dealing with unhappy players is not the only challenge a manager will face.

articles.title: Cup final victory would 'validate' Celtic process - Nancy
articles.summary: Celtic manager Wilfried Nancy says victory in Sunday's Premier Sports Cup final against St Mirren would "validate" what he is trying to implement at his new club.

articles.summary: Midfielder Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall returns to Stamford Bridge on Saturday in outstanding form as Everton look to leapfrog Chelsea in the Premier League.

articles.summary: With Premier League leaders Arsenal hosting bottom club Wolves, is it time to captain Bukayo Saka in your fantasy football team? Our FPL experts give their views.

articles.summary: Strikes from Lucy Bronze, Linda Caicedo and Melchie Dumornay all feature in the best goals of the week from the Women's Champions League.

articles.title: Daly scores in 27 seconds as Villa put three past Liverpool
articles.summary: Rachel Daly scores her first two goals of the season, including one in the first 27 seconds of the match, as Aston Villa beat Liverpool 3-0 in the Women's Super League.

articles.title: Rangers v Hibs, Braga & Martindale in focus
articles.summary: Monday's meeting between Rangers and Hibernian, Heart of Midlothian's Claudio Braga and Livingston manager David Martindale provide talking points in the Scottish Premiership this weekend.

articles.title: 'Nancy exposed to brutal life as Celtic manager as cup final looms'

articles.title: Lennon to miss Dunfermline game after death of father
articles.summary: Neil Lennon will miss Dunfermline Athletic's visit to Glasgow to face Queen's Park on Saturday following the death of the team manager's father.

articles.title: Does Nancy 'know what he's walked in to' amid horror Celtic start?
articles.summary: Wilfried Nancy has become the first Celtic manager to lose his first two games sparking concerns amid the club's supporters.

articles.summary: Coventry City boss Frank Lampard is named the Championship's manager of the month for November with striker Ellis Simms winning the player award.
